text: Those who excel in virtue have the best right of all to rebel, but then they are of all men the least inclined to do so.
author: Aristotle

text: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.
author: Aristotle

text: All men make mistakes, but married men find out about them sooner.
author: Red Skelton

text: The generality of men are naturally apt to be swayed by fear rather than reverence, and to refrain from evil rather because of the punishment that it brings than because of its own foulness.
author: Aristotle

text: Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own.
author: George Bernard Shaw
